result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Simon requesting an adjournment
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

8:46 AM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Akhil K Yamdagni in court.  Attorney Thomas C Simon Aty in court for Akhil K Yamdagni.  Atty. Simon provides an update; he is requesting a plea and sentencing date in about 45 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

08:44 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Akhil K Yamdagni in court with attorney Thomas C Simon.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes a capias was stayed until today's date and matter was set for status to see if substitution of counsel has occured.  Atty. Simon confirms he is now counsel of record in place of Atty. Harrington and is asking the court to quash the capias.  Court will quash the capias.  Atty. Simon provides an update, he is requesting a further proceedings date in about 40 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:14 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Akhil K Yamdagni not in court.  Charles Patrick Hoffmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Thomas Simon in court as a friend of the court on behalf of the defendant.  Atty. Simon provides an update, he notes Atty. Harrington is no longer with the firm and he is in contact with the defendant but has not been formall retained to take over as counsel of record at this time.  Atty. Simon requests an adournment to allow him time to get in contact with the defendant to see if he will be taking over or not, and if the court is inclined to issue a capias that it be stayed until the next court date.  State has no objection to an adjournment and the capias being stayed.  Court will authorize but stay the issuance of a capias and will adjourn for status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on June 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.   Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

01:19 PM Defendant Akhil K Yamdagni in court with attorney Ryan J. Harrington.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.
